docs.snippet: Martin Balsam, a heavyset, baldish character actor whose talents earned him an Oscar, a Tony and roles in scores of films and plays and hundreds of television shows over more than half a century, died yesterday in his hotel room in Rome while on v...
docs.lead_paragraph: Martin Balsam, a heavyset, baldish character actor whose talents earned him an Oscar, a Tony and roles in scores of films and plays and hundreds of television shows over more than half a century, died yesterday in his hotel room in Rome while on vacation there. Mr. Balsam, who lived on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, was 76. The cause was a stroke, his son, Adam, said.

headline.main: Martin Balsam Is Dead at 76; Ubiquitous Character Actor

docs.snippet: When CHARLES GUGGENHEIM, a Washington-based film maker, called his daughter-in-law ELISABETH SHUE to congratulate her for receiving an Academy Award nomination yesterday morning, he did not know that he, too, would be an Oscar contender this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: When CHARLES GUGGENHEIM, a Washington-based film maker, called his daughter-in-law ELISABETH SHUE to congratulate her for receiving an Academy Award nomination yesterday morning, he did not know that he, too, would be an Oscar contender this year. Soon afterward, a member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences called to tell him his history of intolerance in America, "The Shadow of Hate," had been nominated for best documentary short subject.

docs.snippet: THIS YEAR SEEMS typical when it comes to the Oscar race for best foreign-language film. That is to say, complaints and conspiracy theories are rampant. And, as usual, they center on why certain films were not nominated by their respective counprie...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS YEAR SEEMS typical when it comes to the Oscar race for best foreign-language film. That is to say, complaints and conspiracy theories are rampant. And, as usual, they center on why certain films were not nominated by their respective counpries and how difficult it is to change the eligibility rules. The five selected films will be announced on Tuesday, along with other Oscar nominations. Some of the most talked-about foreign-language films released here last year will not be among the nominees because they were not offered up by their home countries. These include several that were critically praised: "Shanghai Triad," from China; "The Postman" ("Il Postino") and "Lamerica," from Italy, and "Wild Reeds" and "Les Miserables," from France. "Les Miserables" won the Golden Globe award three weeks ago.

headline.main: The Usual Spats Over Nominees For Foreign Films
